entry.title: betterhalf - Software Engineer in Test
entry.content:
Minimum Qualifications

  • 1 to 3 years experience onto Manual Testing - preferably Mobile App testing & API testing, and QA processes
  • Basic Knowledge of OOPS Concept along with Python (preferably) or Java coding language
  • Excellent Team player
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • End to end testing of the Betterhalf application on all platforms - Android, iOS, Web and Admin (Internal CRM/LMS)
  • Manual testing - Functional testing, Regression testing, API testing (using POSTMAN), Smoke and Sanity testing
  • test cases as per product requirements/PRD/user stories etc.
  • Use bug-tracking tools like JIRA to log defects and test management tools like TestRail, Qase etc, to write test cases and create test plans etc.
  • Contribute to the Automation Code base for covering Regression Test Cases
  • Comfortable in providing timely and clear updates during Daily Stand-ups to Product Managers, Engineering team leaders (both backend and frontend),and QA members as part of any new feature development or any other improvements/enhancements.
  • Manage and deliver high-quality product releases end-to-end with precision and on all platforms.
  • Extremely hands-on with an ability to roll-up the sleeves and get work done in a timely manner.
Apply

entry.title: betterhalf - Senior Backend Developer
entry.content:
We are looking for a Backend Tech Lead. You will be responsible for architecting and developing end to end delivery of one or more products while collaborating effectively with across teams. You will be joining a talented, collaborative team who is very passionate about solving this massive problem. Based on your experience you may be leading a small team of Engineers.

Tech Stack (Backend): Django, Springboot, Python 3.8/9, Postgres, Redis, Elasticsearch, AWS, GCP, Flask.

Your growth:

  • You’ll experience Series A, B in 24-months and become integrated as a senior leader in engineering management (back-end) in the next 6 months.
  • You’ll see a 50-people team becoming a 200-people and will grab the rarest opportunity to be in the room where company’s decisions are planned with founders, product and engineering leaders.
  • You will be rewarded with a competitive offer on cash and ESOPs.

Job Description/ Responsibilities:

  • Good OO design skills and understanding of different System Design patterns.
  • Expert knowledge of computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.
  • Minimum 3+ years of experience in backend development and infrastructure architecture with ability to handle the entire API design and development.
  • Experience designing highly interactive web applications with performance, scalability, accessibility, usability, design, and security in mind. If you don't have all of these, that's ok, but be excited about learning the few you don't know.
  • Raise the bar on sustainable engineering by improving best practices, producing best in class of code, documentation, testing and monitoring.
  • Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational and no-sql databases.
  • Experience with AWS/GCP/Digital Ocean is required.
  • Experience with architectural trade-offs, applying synchronous and asynchronous design patterns, and delivering with speed while maintaining quality.
  • Bonus: Technical soundness on ML/AI would be a great plus.

Required experience:

3-7 years on backend side

If you always thought of yourself as entrepreneurial, customer obsessed, results-oriented, strategic yet execution focused, hungry and passionate about technology, we have a dream opportunity to back yourself up.

Annual Salary details:

INR 35-55L (fixed) + INR 50L-1Cr (ESOPs) + Additional variable Incentive based on performance

Why should you reach out?

If you are looking to build and contribute to the mission of building the next generation matrimony product for urban Indians, please reach out. We're super thrilled to partner and make you succeed.

Note: This role is a full time role in Bangalore (and not remote).

Apply

entry.title: furlenco - SDE2 - IOS Developer
entry.content:
What is Furlenco?

Furlenco is India’s first subscription based furniture company. In an era of mobility, we find that a lot of people want the freedom to choose what they want their homes to look like without tying themselves down by buying furniture. Our business caters to the massive market of urban India.

What’s more, we have come through the COVID-19 pandemic situation unscathed! And we are growing. We are looking for exciting minds to join our tech team to drive further growth.

What about you?

Do you have your own apps on the App Store or cool projects on GitHub? Do you pride yourself on logical thinking and love solving problems? Are you looking for that kickass job at one of India’s fastest growing e-commerce start ups?

At Furlenco, we believe in freedom. Not just of speech and expression, but code. We have a robust and constantly evolving tech stack which you can take a dive into and impact the experience of thousands of our daily users. And we build at scale. An array of consumer and platform products created by some of the smartest minds in the industry.

You get an opportunity to work at a fast paced startup environment and change the way people look at renting as a way of life. Work on hitherto unexplored technologies such as Augmented and Virtual Reality.

  • Great eye for Design, UI and UX.
  • You are a massive Apple fangirl (or boy)
  • Watch Apple events over a mug (or pitcher) of beer.
  • Reducing a few KBs of your iOS app lets you sleep peacefully at night.
  • You are an ace at app development with Swift.
  • Brownie points if you are familiar with multiple technologies (React Native, Android/Kotlin).

You should apply if you have:

  • 2 to 4 years of experience in product development, architecture and design.
  • You have proven experience with storage, threading and ability to tune apps for performance.
  • You have strong knowledge of Object oriented programming and Swift UI/Auto layout components, including familiarity with RESTful APIs.
  • You have in the past worked on consumer mobile products with an e-commerce organization.
  • You have your own apps on the App store and/or cool projects on GitHub - that’s a great first line to share when you respond to us.
  • Good knowledge in pixel-perfect implementation of designs.
  • Should be familiar with architectural patterns like MVP, MVVM, MVC.
  • The ability to function in a team and work towards a common goal. Ability to grow and help others grow.

What you get:

  • An environment to rapidly experiment with newer technologies like wearables, VR & augmented reality app development.
  • An opportunity to work in a fast paced, startup environment.
  • You get to be part of a versatile team, an opportunity to display leadership qualities and a platform to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
  • Translate designs and wireframes into high-quality code.
Apply

entry.title: furlenco - SDE3/Staff Engineer - Java
entry.content:
What is Furlenco?

Furlenco is India’s first subscription based furniture company. In an era of mobility, we find that a lot of people want the freedom to choose what they want their homes to look like without tying themselves down by buying furniture. Our business caters to the massive market of urban India.

What’s more, we have come through the COVID-19 pandemic situation unscathed! And we are growing. We are looking for exciting minds to join our tech team to drive further growth.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor in Computer Science or related field
  • 6+ years of experience in software development and full product life-cycles
  • Experience in distributed systems and algorithms (Map-Reduce)
  • Experience with non-relational databases (MongoDb, Cassandra, Hbase, DynamoDb), designing schemas
  • Basic knowledge in machine learning, data mining, artificial intelligence, and statistics.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Coding skills in Java coupled with strong base in object-oriented design, functional programming and development
  • You understand basic data structures & algorithms, relational databases, RESTful web services and have good working knowledge of SQL
  • Experience on Java based web frameworks such as Spring Boot, Play, Dropwizard, or Java EE.
  • Experience in distributed system design and microservices. Exposure to messaging queues such as RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka
  • Excellent problem solving skills and understanding of Object Oriented Design and Patterns - GoF, anyone?
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to technically lead small to midsize teams and mentor junior members
  • Hands on experience with UI frameworks - React or Angular
  • Working experience with Docker/Kubernetes on AWS or any other cloud provider

Preferred qualifications:

  • You work on the core components of Furlenco technology stack - platforms powering our web portal, mobile apps, our customer experience systems, the warehouse & logistics management systems, billing & invoicing systems, payment infrastructure, risk & collection system, pricing engine etc. You will be part of a rewarding and challenging startup environment.
  • The role will allow you to lead a team and manage delivery of products & services from inception to delivery.
  • You will be both a highly technical hands-on engineer and an effective team leader. You will work with product managers to plan and execute releases, and realize the vision of our next generation products.
  • You will be hands-on with system design, data structures, relational and NoSQL databases, RESTful web services, Object Oriented Design and Patterns, handling scale

entry.title: furlenco - Senior Product Designer
entry.content:
About Furlenco

Furlenco is a furniture and appliance subscription platform. We enable the urban Indian to live better today in their homes, by providing access to award-winning furniture and home decor on rent. We’re technology driven and leverage technology for everything from customer experience to risk management and fulfilment services.

Job description

Furlenco is looking for an experienced Senior Product Manager to drive our core subscriptions and order fulfilment services. This includes order processing and fulfilment platforms, subscription billing and payments, risk platforms and a collection of supporting services. As a Product Manager, you’ll own the entire product lifecycle from requirements to GTM of your products. You’ll also collaborate with multiple teams and ensure that all systems are working perfectly.

What’ll you do

  • You’ll own multiple products and drive efforts across their lifecycle
  • You’ll collaborate with business teams to understand the requirements and transform the vision and goals into a product roadmap
  • You’ll align with UX, Engg & QA teams to drive execution of product features
  • You’ll track performance of all your products and iteratively work on improving them
  • You will also evangelize your product to all the stakeholders and drive successful adoption

Requirements

  • 4-8+ years as a Product Manager where you’ve owned complete products
  • Good grasp of how microservices work & how to design independent modules that come together to perform a massive task
  • Strong grasp on APIs, data modelling and querying
  • Ability to drive adoption, monitor metrics and iterate with business

Good to have skills:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field is preferred
  • MBA is preferred
  • Experience in building products from scratch and overseeing its evolution
Apply
